sen.j: 朽木 友綱（くつき ともつな、慶長4年（1599年） - 寛文2年8月8日 (旧暦)（1662年9月20日））は、江戸時代初期の旗本。
sen.e: Tomotsuna KUTSUKI (1599 - September 20, 1662) was a hatamoto (direct retainer of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)), who lived during the early Edo Period.

sen.e: He served Tadaoki HOSOKAWA, and he received 20 silver coins for the merit he achieved in Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka).

sen.j: 元綱の死後、その遺領は宣綱6300余石、友綱2015余石、稙綱1100余石と兄弟3名で分割相続し、友綱は旗本となった。
sen.e: After Mototsuna's death, his inheritance property was divided into three parts, and Noritsuna inherited a little more than 6,300-koku (about 1,136.5 cubic meters) crop yields, Tomotsuna a little more than 2,015-koku (about 363.5 cubic meters) crop yields, Tsunetsuna succeeded a little more than 1,100-koku (about 198.4 cubic meters), respectively, and Tomotsuna became a hatamoto.

sen.j: 歩行頭となり、寛永10年（1633年）に将軍家御用の新茶を運ぶ宇治採茶使を神尾守勝、近藤用行、安藤正珍と務める。
sen.e: He became a chief of guards, and in 1633 he took charge of Uji saicha shi (a messenger who carries a pot of new tea leaves picked in Uji) for the use of the Shogun family, with Morikatsu KAMIO, Michiyuki KONDO, and Masayoshi ANDO.
